channel.title: Big Bang (Work in progress, quick sketch) | NuJazz, electronic jazz, funk
channel.description:
**Big Bang (Work in progress)**, by thomasonline.pl, [NuJazz, Jazz, Funk, Electronic Jazz]
**Link**: [https://soundcloud.com/thomasonline-633982140/big-bang-work-in-progressive/s-YeQBI68fu9y](https://soundcloud.com/thomasonline-633982140/big-bang-work-in-progressive/s-YeQBI68fu9y)
**Notes**: I try to make it sound as 'live' as possible using Auxy. My bigest problem is with percussion it's hard to make it swing - like jazz perc should, any ideas, examples? Maybe any midi files to download and learn? **Can ya give me any links?** I have tried to cut parts of live loops and use it, but changed my mind as I feel it would be cheating - I want to make it - note by note, beat by beat from the scratch without using any loops. As for acoustic bass/upright bass used here - it was cut from few sources into 'one shoots' - I have made new instrument than written it's line note by note, from the scratch - thanks to this I can completely control it. There are few notes missing but thanks to pitch-shifting I can play most of needed notes.
Thanks for constructive feedback and remember its fresh work (in progress) - I have started just 2 days ago and had been playing with it only just for aprox. 30 minutes, so don't be too harsh.
**My other stuff, click link below:** **[https://soundcloud.com/thomasonline-633982140](https://soundcloud.com/thomasonline-633982140)**

item.title: Big Bang (Work in progress, quick sketch) | NuJazz, electronic jazz, funk
item.dc:creator: cursed
item.description:
Use longer rides, it gives more flow

Edit: I take it back a little, its really up to you how you do jazz. I personally prefer jazz when the instruments connect but theres all kinds of jazz

Read full topic

item.title: Big Bang (Work in progress, quick sketch) | NuJazz, electronic jazz, funk
item.dc:creator: traverse
item.description:
To get swing on any drum or sound, you just have to tap on the cog icon in the top right of a project, and between the tempo and key sliders there is a slider to control how much swing you want in that track. Alternatively you could just use triplets in a pattern like this:

Also, swing doesn’t do anything to triplets.
Hope this helps!

Read full topic
item.source: Big Bang (Work in progress, quick sketch) | NuJazz, electronic jazz, funk

item.title: Big Bang (Work in progress, quick sketch) | NuJazz, electronic jazz, funk
item.dc:creator: thomasonline
item.description:
Big Bang (Work in progress), by thomasonline.pl, [NuJazz, Jazz, Funk, Electronic Jazz]

Link: https://soundcloud.com/thomasonline-633982140/big-bang-work-in-progressive/s-YeQBI68fu9y

Notes: I try to make it sound as ‘live’ as possible using Auxy. My bigest problem is with percussion it’s hard to make it swing - like jazz perc should, any ideas, examples? Maybe any midi files to download and learn? Can ya give me any links?
I have tried to cut parts of live loops and use it, but changed my mind as I feel it would be cheating - I want to make it - note by note, beat by beat from the scratch without using any loops. As for acoustic bass/upright bass used here - it was cut from few sources into ‘one shoots’ - I have made new instrument than written it’s line note by note, from the scratch - thanks to this I can completely control it. There are few notes missing but thanks to pitch-shifting I can play most of needed notes.

Thanks for constructive feedback and remember its fresh work (in progress) - I have started just 2 days ago and had been playing with it only just for aprox. 30 minutes, so don’t be too harsh.

My other stuff, click link below:
https://soundcloud.com/thomasonline-633982140

Read full topic
